inlineContent.text: Materials define the appearance of 3D models in RealityKit, by defining how their surfaces interact with light. Materials can also occlude objects behind them, hold shaders, or act as portals to view other worlds with
RealityKit includes a few material types to help you get started, including
for basic color and textures, and
for realistic lighting effects such as reflections, roughness, and emission.

abstract.text: Apply textures to the surface of your scene’s 3D objects to give each object a unique appearance.
Bring an iOS or iPadOS game to visionOS and enhance it.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Rendering a windowed game in stereo

abstract.text: The type used to represent opacity information.
A texture object that you use to create custom materials.
An object that specifies an entity’s normal map.
A component that turns mesh surfaces into portals to a different world.
An enumeration used to specify how mipmaps are allocated and generated
for this texture.
An object that defines the specular highlights of an entity.
A container for texture data allowing you to create and update textures using your own format.
Lock virtual content to the real world.
The type used to represent base color.
An alias for the cull mode object that’s appropriate for this material class.
Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
An object that holds texture resource creation options.
The parameter type that custom materials uses for properties the
framework passes to shader functions.
The type used to represent textures.
Use low-level mesh and texture APIs to achieve fast updates to a person’s brush
strokes by integrating RealityKit with ARKit and SwiftUI.

doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation.title: Creating a spatial drawing app with RealityKit

abstract.text: The abstract superclass for objects representing compute functions for RealityKit custom materials .

A container for resources that will be encoded into a CustomMaterial’s custom uniforms argument buffer.
The object type that custom material use to hold UV texture coordinates.
An object that defines an entity’s reflectiveness.
An alias for the cull mode object that’s appropriate for this material class.
An object that defines how the surface of an entity scatters the light
it reflects.

abstract.text: An alias for the color type that’s appropriate for the current platform.

abstract.text: An invisible material that hides objects rendered behind it.

Use windows, volumes, and immersive spaces to teach people about the Earth.

objects.
